articles.author: Maya Gebeily, James Mackenzie, John Irish
articles.description: The Paris conference aims to mobilise both humanitarian aid and support for the Lebanese military.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills Lebanese troops as France rallies support for army

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel, Tom Balmforth, Maria Martinez
articles.description: Ukraine's bid to have Russia added to an international list of countries with weak money laundering compliance has failed again after the move was rejected by countries including China, India, Saudi Arabia and South Africa, three sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Ukraine's bid to add Russia to FATF's 'black list' fails again, rejected by China, India and others

articles.author: Jonathan Saul, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Instead of the Israeli military's preferred approach of quick decisive actions, many former security officials say the army risks being bogged down in an open-ended campaign requiring a permanent troop presence.
articles.title: With no exit strategy for Israel in Gaza, critics fear an open-ended stay

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: In Uruguay's capital Montevideo and around this South American nation of 3.4 million people, voters are gearing up for Sunday's election, overshadowed by a plebiscite on pensions the same day and fears over crime.
articles.title: Uruguay set for election dominated by pensions, crime

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) on Friday announced it would replace on health grounds one of the judges deciding on a prosecution request to issue an arrest warrant for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, a move that could spark further delays in the case.
articles.title: ICC replaces on health grounds judge mulling request for Netanyahu arrest warrant

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Leaders of the Group of Seven wealthy nations have reached consensus on how to deliver around $50 billion in loans to Ukraine backed by the earnings from frozen Russian sovereign assets, a statement said on Friday.
articles.title: G7 leaders agree on how to deliver around $50 billion in loans to Ukraine

articles.author: Gabriella Borter, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: President Joe Biden formally apologized on Friday for the U.S. government's role in running abusive Native American boarding schools for more than 150 years, and was heckled at the event over his support for Israel's war in Gaza.
articles.title: Biden apology for Indian boarding schools interrupted by Gaza war protester

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: The Canadian government should have acted sooner to stem the flow of temporary migration into the country, Immigration Minister Marc Miller told Reuters on Friday.
articles.title: Canada should have acted sooner on migration, minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three journalists were killed in Lebanon by an Israeli strike.
articles.title: Deadly Israeli strike on journalists in Lebanon prompts global condemnation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's National Assembly on Friday approved an amendment to the government's 2025 belt-tightening budget bill that would hit the country's wealthiest individuals with a billionaires tax.
articles.title: French lower house approves budget amendment to tax billionaires
